questions.question_text:
Universal Containers has a product that can either be sold in increments of one year or can be purchased by customers and priced per month until the customer cancels their subscription.
Which two actions should the admin take to set this product up so it can be renewed or last perpetually? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A and B are correct

choices.C: Create a workflow rule to check the Evergreen checkbox on the generated contract.
choices.B: Set the product up to use the Renewable/Evergreen value in the Subscription Type field.
choices.A: Expose the Subscription Type field in the Quote Line Editor, allowing sales reps to choose between Renewable and Evergreen.
choices.D: Set the product up to use the Renewable value in the Subscription Type field.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) uses USD, GBP, and EUR and has Multi-Currency enabled.
UC products have two sets of USD prices: one for American customers and one for Asia Pacific customers.
UC products have one set of EUR and GBP prices for European customers.
What is the most effective way to set up UC's Price Books?

choices.A: Create three Price Books, one for each region (America. Asia Pacific, Europe).
choices.D: Create four Price Books, one for each unique currency and region (America - USD, Asia Pacific - USD, Europe - EUR, Europe - GBP).
choices.B: Create two Price Books: one for standard USD, EUR. and GBP prices, and one for USD in Asia Pacific.
choices.C: Create three Price Books, one for each currency (USD, EUR, GBP).

discussion.content: B, one price book for USD (Americas), EUR, and GBP and a 2nd price book for USD (AsiaPacific)

comments.content:
one for American customers in USD , one for Asia Pacific customers in USD and one for European customers in both EUR & GBP currencies.

https://milomassimo.com/Salesforce-CPQ-Price-Book-Entries-and-Multi-Currencies.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A as Price Books can have prices for several currencies, so you don't have to create a Price Book for each currency.

choices.C: Create a bundle with a Configuration Attribute.
choices.A: Create multiple bundles with Validation Product Rules.
choices.B: Create a Hidden Search Filter in Product Selection based on Profile.
choices.D: Create a Product Rule where Type = Filter.

discussion.content:
B - would need to create a field on the Quote record to read the running user's profile and then match that against another pre-populated field on the Product

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers has multiple sales teams that need to select from a subset of the product catalog on the Product Selection page.

Which solution meets the business requirement without creating a separate Price Book?

A user is renewing a Contract that was uploaded during a data migration. There is no Opportunity or Quote associated to the Contract. After renewing the Contract, the user has noticed that the Price Book on the Renewal Opportunity and Quote is incorrect.

What should the admin do to resolve this issue?

discussion.content: Choose C. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000381708&type=1. "In order to use the new Price Book on future Contract Amendments and Renewals, copy the Price Book ID and paste it into the Amendment Pricebook ID and/or Renewal Pricebook ID fields on the Contract or Service Contract."
I've put A. The contract has been renewed already
C - need to set the Renewal Pricebook Id

choices.C: Populate the Renewal Pricebook ID field on the Contract.
choices.A: Build Automation to automatically populate the correct Price Book on the Renewal Quote.
choices.D: Associate an Order with the correct Price Book to the Contract before renewing.
choices.B: Populate the Opportunity or Quote Price Book Id field on the Contract.
